header.name: chaos/preprocessor/seq/variadic/filter.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines an algorithm that filters elements from a according to a user-specified criteria.

macro.abstract: The macro filters elements from its second argument according to the criteria specified by its first argument.

usage.param:
The predicate that determines whether an element is to remain in the resulting . This predicate must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
pred(s, tuple)

param.para:
The predicate that determines whether an element is to remain in the resulting . This predicate must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
pred(s, tuple, data†)
† The data pseudo-parameter must be either ... or the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of arguments in the auxiliary data, __VA_ARGS__.

usage.param: Auxiliary data to be passed through the algorithm to the predicate.

macro.para:
This macro behaves identically to except that each element is wrapped in parentheses prior to being passed to the predicate. For example, instead of the predicate being invoked as...
pred(s, elem, data)
it is invoked as...
pred(s, (elem), data)
This macro deduces the current and invokes . If the current is already known, direct use of is more efficient.
